title: Zinedine Zidane backs former team-mate Raul to be Real Madrid boss
text:
Current Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane believes club legend Raul will one day be manager, according to Goal.

The iconic former striker, who took over as head coach of Madrid's famed Castilla reserve side at the start of the season, has been posting impressive results.

If he does eventually become Madrid boss, he would be following the career path of Zidane himself up from Castilla to the senior side.

Raul is seen as Madrid's eternal captain and is still idolised by supporters even today

Current Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane believes Raul will one day be manager of the club

'I played alongside him and he was an important player for this great club,' Zidane reportedly said.

RAUL'S REAL MADRID STATS Real Madrid career: 1994-2010 Games: 741 Goals: 325 Assists: 108 Trophies: La Liga x6, Spanish Cup x4, Champions League x3

'I'm sure he'll coach Real Madrid one day.'

Former manager Jorge Valdano, who played for Madrid between 1984 and 1987, before later going on to manage the club and handing Raul his debut, recently penned a column in El Pais.

In it, he outlined how Raul is the 'future' of the club, as well as a decorated part of its past. His opinion quickly went viral in the Spanish capital, and Raul refused to rule out the possibility.

'It's a column based on personal opinion and I am trying to earn praise in order to have this possibility in the future,' he said.

Real Madrid legend Raul refused to rule out claims that he wants to manage his former club

'I have always said that I arrived here as a manager a year and a half ago, I did my courses and I am here, the only thing I can do is keep working,' he added.

'I am happy to be home, in my club and in the future we will see. Now, I am focused on Castilla, in learning by the day and in instilling Real Madrid's values on the players.'
description: Current Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane believes club legend Raul will one day be manager, according to Goal. Raul is currently manager of the Castilla reserve side.
